channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-17863] Procedure V2: Proc Executor cleanup. Split FINISHED state to two states: SUCCESS and FAILED.
item.description: Clean up around isFinished() and procedure executor
item.summary: Procedure V2: Proc Executor cleanup. Split FINISHED state to two states: SUCCESS and FAILED.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: +1 Nice cleanup.

-1 overall

Those failures are interesting uagashe Looks like there is a dependency on a fuzzy semantic....
saint.ack@gmail.com, yes, looking into it.

Currently the procedure with exception and in FINISHED state is considered as failed and needs rollback. But though the state is FINISHED its not terminal state. Added FAILED state. All procedures in FAILED state need to be rolled back. Change FINISH to SUCCESS, to make it more clear that its a positive terminal state.
Fixed a few typos.

This message was automatically generated.
TestAcidGuarantees fail similar number of times with or without the patch for this JIRA.

I do not see how this change which pertains to macro ops – i.e. procedures – can disturb a data read messing w/ row consistency view. Let me push it. Thanks for testing uagashe Did you do any work to compare before and after and if so, what was it sir! Thanks.
Pushed.
I tested it on my laptop. Each test runs 3 times in a single run and I ran it 10 times with and without the patch.

so afaiu,

old semantic new semantic
finished and exception FAILED
finished and no exception SUCCESS

They SUCCESS state implies no exception, then do we need the and condition below

public synchronized boolean isSuccess() {
  return state == ProcedureState.SUCCESS && !hasException();
}

Why are we switching the order here?

-      // Commit the transaction
-      updateStoreOnExec(procStack, procedure, subprocs);
-
       // if the store is not running we are aborting
       if (!store.isRunning()) return;
 
+      // Commit the transaction
+      updateStoreOnExec(procStack, procedure, subprocs);
+

nit: (only in case there's an addendum) rename ProcedureTestingUtility#setFinishedState to setSuccessState()
working on addendum, will attach it soon.
On the second change, uagashe put it under my nose and I thought it made sense.... but you raise a good point appy

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #2812 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/2812/)
HBASE-17863: Procedure V2: Some cleanup around Procedure.isFinished() (stack: rev 9109803891e256f8c047af72572f07695e604a3f)

  • (edit) hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/ProcedureUtil.java
  • (edit) hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/store/ProcedureStore.java
  • (edit) hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/procedure/TestProcedureAdmin.java
  • (edit) hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ProcedureState.java

  • (edit) hbase-procedure/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/store/wal/ProcedureWALLoaderPerformanceEvaluation.java
  • (edit) hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/ProcedureExecutor.java
  • (edit) hbase-procedure/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/ProcedureTestingUtility.java
  • (edit) hbase-protocol-shaded/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/shaded/protobuf/generated/ProcedureProtos.java
  • (edit) hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/Procedure.java
  • (edit) hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/store/wal/ProcedureWALFormatReader.java

Thanks appy for reviewing this patch and your review comments. I appreciate for pointing out in comment #2 that reversing the order affects shutdown. I have reverted that change in the addendum. saint.ack@gmail.com, appy please review the addendum and let me know your feedback.

IMHO, that code can be improved in the long run including readability but considering the patch is already checked in addendum I have reverted the change. Addendum also has changes for comment #3.

re comment #1 The check is still needed, as the patch doesn't have any change with respect to letting set exception when procedure state is SUCCESS or ROLLEDBACK.

Thanks, Umesh

+1 on addendum.
Thanks for the patch uagashe.

+1 overall
